text: where have all the airships gone an
airship is exactly what its name
suggests the airborne equivalent of an
ocean liner capable of covering vast
distances in style and comfort and
offering such luxuries as a dining room
metal cutlery and even a piano bar
beautiful mystical and supremely
dignified it's hard not to think of the
airship as an excellent idea but a few
bits of bad PR put paid to them an
airship floats in the air so it has to
be filled with something lighter than
air originally this was the easily
produced but highly inflammable hydrogen
later airships and all modern ones use
the more expensive but much safer gas
that gives you a dull voice when you
suck on a party balloon helium there are
three basic types of airship rigid
airships are huge and built around an
internal metal structure with the
lifting gas contained in separate cells
semi rigid airships are smaller have
some structure but also a collapsible
section blimps are really just specially
shaped balloons sometimes with a gondola
slung underneath but all of these terms
are used quite loosely the world's first
true airline deutsches lucia farts
Aktiengesellschaft was formed in 1909
using Zeppelin airships and between 1910
and the outbreak of World War one it
carried 34,000 passengers on 1500
journeys and although a number of these
airships were lost in crashes and fires
there was not a single crew or passenger
injury World War one soared a lags
airships transferred to the military
where they were responsible for the
first bit of negative airship PR
Zeppelin's were use for the bombing of
civilians notably in London and Paris in
England they became known as baby
killers
but between the wars the airship entered
its golden age many people still
believed that fixed-wing aircraft would
never be safe or reliable enough for
long-haul travel Britain and Germany in
particular plotted a glorious airship
revolution Britain's state-funded r101 a
ship crashed in France on its maiden
voyage
to India and although the impact was
light the whole ship was consumed by
fire when the hydrogen ignited the
privately funded our 100 rival airship
was scrapped as a result Germany's
airship programme was more impressive
the most successful of its ships the
Graf Zeppelin remained in service for
nine accident three years
it made 144 ocean crossings
circumnavigated the globe and remained
the loft for a total of almost two years
but it is the later Hindenburg which is
remembered because it was the subject of
the world's first televised disaster
when it crashed in a giant fireball at
Lakehurst New Jersey in 1937 on its 63rd
flight as a result of that all other
Zeppelin's were scrapped ironically Hugo
Eckener the pacifistic boss of the
Zeppelin company had demanded that the
Hindenburg be filled with safe helium
after seeing how hydrogen had destroyed
the r101 during its crash but only the
USA could produce helium in sufficient
quantities and America had banned its
export to Germany following the rise of
the Nazis that was the end of the
airship dream but the idea didn't
disappear completely small airships most
famously the Goodyear blimp was still
used for advertising and as stable
camera platforms Zeppelin company was
reformed in the 90s to make medium-sized
semi-rigid passenger-carrying airships
most recently the US has produced the
Northrop Grumman long endurance multi
intelligence vehicle which can stay
aloft for three weeks at 20,000 feet for
intelligence
gathering other airship evangelists and
visions truly massive airship freighters
that could shift huge machine parts and
other giant loads all around the globe
using minimal energy so the airship may
simply be suffering a brief hiatus
caused largely by the hazard of using
hydrogen the airship may rise again get
it why not subscribe here you can hear
me answer more of your intelligent
questions more historical stuff from
knowledge badger are more of our live
experiments this is head squeeze
squeezing your head in the interests of
making you a more renascent sort of man
or woman
